overview: After a contentious race last fall, the runoff for mayor of New Orleans came down to two candidates: Desir√©e Charbonnet and LaToya Cantrell, two very different black women. The winner of this election would take office as the first female mayor of New Orleans and the city's fourth black mayor. Through news footage, campaign advertisements and archival audio and video, All Skinfolk Ain't Kinfolk is the unprecedented story of this mayoral runoff told through the eyes of black women living in this city.
tagline: A contentious mayoral race in New Orleans comes down to two very different black women, demonstrating that All Skinfolk Ain't Kinfolk.
title: All Skinfolk Ain't Kinfolk
